Title: KDE kjs: URI heap overflow vulnerability
Synopsis:
KDE fails to properly validate URIs when handling javascript, potentially
    resulting in the execution of arbitrary code.

Background.Text: KDE is a feature-rich graphical desktop environment for Linux and Unix-like Operating Systems. kjs is the javascript interpreter used in Konqueror and other parts of KDE.

Description.Text: Maksim Orlovich discovered an incorrect bounds check in kjs when handling URIs.

Impact.Text: By enticing a user to load a specially crafted webpage containing malicious javascript, an attacker could execute arbitrary code with the rights of the user running kjs.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All kdelibs users should upgrade to the latest version:

URI.Text: KDE Security Advisory: kjs encodeuri/decodeuri heap overflow vulnerability
